node.title: Katherine close contacts to be re-tested, residents urged to monitor health after wastewater samples test positive for COVID
node.alt: A hand pouring wastewater into a beaker
node.description: COVID viral fragments have been detected in wastewater in the Northern Territory town of Katherine, prompting health authorities to ask residents to monitor their health for any symptoms.
node.content:
["Health authorities say Katherine residents should closely monitor their health for any symptoms of COVID-19, after positive wastewater samples were picked up following the Top End's latest outbreak.", "Northern Territory Health Minister Natasha Fyles said no new COVID cases linked to the Darwin-Katherine cluster that sparked last week's lockdowns and lockouts\u00a0have been recorded in the past 24 hours.", "But she said COVID viral fragments had been detected in both of the catchment areas in Katherine, where the index case came forward last Thursday.", "Ms Fyles said the Bicentennial Road catchment area was of concern for authorities after viral traces\u00a0were detected there for November 7-8, though not for\u00a0November 5-6.", "She also said the Katherine Golf Club catchment area had recorded\u00a0positive results for November 5-6\u00a0but had been negative for November 7-8.", "Ms Fyles said further wastewater testing\u00a0was underway in Katherine to monitor the situation\u00a0and the previously identified 12 close contacts from the area\u00a0would be re-tested today.", "She said despite the results the government had no plans to introduce further restrictions in Katherine\u00a0but was urging residents to monitor their health.", "\"[The result] shows that there are traces of COVID in that catchment,\" she said.", "\"We're calling on residents of Katherine, if they are feeling any symptoms at all \u2013 loss of taste, feeling slightly unwell, headaches, fever \u2013 please reach out to get tested.\"", "", "
Close contacts in Katherine will re-tested following the results.(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "No COVID traces were detected in the Greater Darwin area.", "Katherine came out of a lockout, following a lockdown that lasted several days, on Monday.", "A five-day lockout in Greater Darwin\u00a0ended on Tuesday.", "A mask mandate, which requires masks to be worn whenever maintaining a 1.5 distance from others isn't possible, is in place in both regions until 5pm Friday.", "Ms Fyles said one new COVID case had been detected in the NT \u2014 a 20-year-old Victorian man employed by\u00a0the\u00a0Australian Defence Force, who had arrived in the NT on Monday and gone straight into the Bladin Village military quarantine centre.", "She\u00a0said the case, which has since been transferred to the Howard Springs quarantine facility,\u00a0posed a \"very low risk\" to the NT.", "", "
Ms Fyles says Katherine residents should not be alarmed, but should carefully monitor their health.(ABC News: Nicholas Hynes)
", "
Proof of vaccination now linked to Territory Check-In app
", "Earlier today, NT Public Employment Minister Paul Kirby revealed Territorians now have the option of linking their digital COVID-19 vaccination certificates to the Territory Check-In app.", "Other ways of displaying the certificate, either digitally or in hard copy, will continue to be valid.", "\"Now Territorians can provide proof of their vaccination as simply as checking in,\" Mr Kirby\u00a0said.", "\"This new feature will help businesses and Territorians to continue doing the right thing, helping us all stay safe.\"", "Mr Kirby also admitted he still doesn't know how many public sector workers are refusing to be vaccinated ahead of the start of the NT's wide-ranging COVID vaccine mandate this weekend.", "Under the mandate, almost every worker in the NT will be required to have had at least one dose of the vaccine from Saturday.", "Mr Kirby\u00a0said he should have a \"better\u00a0idea\" of the numbers by tomorrow\u00a0afternoon."]
